alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 11 at 3:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St. Croix River at Danbury. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 3.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 945 PM CDT.
